title: Gary Neville admits to Liverpool and Man Utd comparison he refused to make on air
text:

Gary Neville reluctantly admitted he sees parallels between Liverpool and his Manchester United title-winning sides of the past.

Neville won eight Premier League titles at Old Trafford during their golden era under Sir Alex Ferguson, with Jurgen Klopp's Reds looking to emulate the achievements of their rivals and finally end their title drought.

They cemented their place at the top of the table by coming from behind to beat Tottenham 2-1 in front of a watching Neville on Sky Sports duty at Anfield.

With a six point lead over Manchester City after just 10 games of the season, Klopp's side are firm favourites to go one better than they did last year in the title race.

And Neville admitted he sees them as title winners - but only when later pressed on Sky Sports having resisted the urge to voice his comparison with the Red Devils whilst on-air on co-commentary duty.

(Image: Getty Images)

Asked on Sky Sports if he thought Liverpool looked like title winners he had played with, he explained: "Yeah, I thought during the second half, I was going to say it on air but didn't, about the teams we played in at Manchester United.

"There is a complete trust in this crowd, they are brilliant to watch and they are scintillating.

"I agree with Jamie (Carragher) that there was only one winner at half-time and I thought that at 20 minutes to go.

"They have played title winning football now for two years. You can't compare them to Man City. They are a completely different team.

"They are relentless and they should win a title playing the football and amassing the points they have."

(Image: Getty Images)

But whilst those comments will come as music to the ears of Liverpool fans, Neville left them upset by labelling Mohamed Salah "theatrical" for going down in the box.

He was branded "biased" by some Reds fans, who voiced their displeasure at the former United player on social media.
description: Gary Neville has compared Liverpool with the Premier League title-winning Manchester United sides he was involved in
